name: Marcello Sega's GitHub Pages
body:
### Welcome to my GitHub Pages.
I am a scientist working at the border between chemistry and physics. My main investigation tool is computer simulations. For this reason I am often developing scientific software, and some of it is now on github. Feel free to download and use my code: just, please, give credit where credit is due! If you are unsure on how to do that, drop me an email.

My actual projects hosted on GitHub are:

* [A Gromacs version with Gaussian charges](http://marcello-sega.github.io/gromacs/)
* [ITIM/GITIM implementation for gromacs](http://marcello-sega.github.io/gitim/)
* [A flexible/efficient code to compute correlation functions](http://marcello-sega.github.io/fftcw/)

I am also contributing to [ESPResSo](http://espressomd.org/) with [my GitHub fork](https://github.com/Marcello-Sega/espresso)

If you are looking for my scientific activity, instead, you'd better look at some of the following pages:

* http://www.researcherid.com/rid/C-8863-2009
* http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=wg8kiOAAAAAJ
* http://www.mdy.univie.ac.at/people/sega/sega.html

Enjoy!
